verses.text: And if a soul sin , and hear the voice of swearing , and \add is\add* a witness , whether he hath seen or known \add of it;\add* if he do not utter \add it\add*, then he shall bear his iniquity.

Or if a soul touch any unclean thing , whether \add it be\add* a carcase of an unclean beast , or a carcase of unclean cattle , or the carcase of unclean creeping things , and \add if\add* it be hidden from him; he also shall be unclean , and guilty.
Or if he touch the uncleanness of man , whatsoever uncleanness \add it be\add* that a man shall be defiled withal, and it be hid from him; when he knoweth \add of it\add*, then he shall be guilty.

Or if a soul swear , pronouncing with \add his\add* lips to do evil , or to do good , whatsoever \add it be\add* that a man shall pronounce with an oath , and it be hid from him; when he knoweth \add of it\add*, then he shall be guilty in one of these.
And it shall be, when he shall be guilty in one of these \add things\add*, that he shall confess that he hath sinned in that \add thing:\add*

And he shall bring his trespass offering unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* for his sin which he hath sinned , a female from the flock , a lamb or a kid of the goats , for a sin offering ; and the priest shall make an atonement for him concerning his sin. \p

And if he be not able to bring a lamb , then he shall bring for his trespass , which he hath committed , two turtledoves , or two young pigeons , unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; one for a sin offering , and the other for a burnt offering.\f + \fr 5.7 \ft he be…: Heb. his hand cannot reach to the sufficiency of a lamb\f*

And he shall bring them unto the priest , who shall offer \add that\add* which \add is\add* for the sin offering first , and wring off his head from his neck , but shall not divide \add it\add* asunder :
And he shall sprinkle of the blood of the sin offering upon the side of the altar ; and the rest of the blood shall be wrung out at the bottom of the altar : it \add is\add* a sin offering.

And he shall offer the second \add for\add* a burnt offering , according to the manner : and the priest shall make an atonement for him for his sin which he hath sinned , and it shall be forgiven him.\f + \fr 5.10 \ft manner: or, ordinance\f* \p

¶ But if he be not able to bring two turtledoves , or two young pigeons , then he that sinned shall bring for his offering the tenth part of an ephah of fine flour for a sin offering ; he shall put no oil upon it, neither shall he put \add any\add* frankincense thereon: for it \add is\add* a sin offering.

Then shall he bring it to the priest , and the priest shall take his handful of it, \add even\add* a memorial thereof, and burn \add it\add* on the altar , according to the offerings made by fire unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: it \add is\add* a sin offering.

And the priest shall make an atonement for him as touching his sin that he hath sinned in one of these, and it shall be forgiven him: and \add the remnant\add* shall be the priest’s , as a meat offering. \p
¶ And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* spake unto Moses , saying ,

If a soul commit a trespass , and sin through ignorance , in the holy things of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*; then he shall bring for his trespass unto the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* a ram without blemish out of the flocks , with thy estimation by shekels of silver , after the shekel of the sanctuary , for a trespass offering :

And he shall make amends for the harm that he hath done in the holy thing , and shall add the fifth part thereto, and give it unto the priest : and the priest shall make an atonement for him with the ram of the trespass offering , and it shall be forgiven him. \p

¶ And if a soul sin , and commit any of these things which are forbidden to be done by the commandments of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; though he wist \add it\add* not, yet is he guilty , and shall bear his iniquity.

And he shall bring a ram without blemish out of the flock , with thy estimation , for a trespass offering , unto the priest : and the priest shall make an atonement for him concerning his ignorance wherein he erred and wist \add it\add* not, and it shall be forgiven him.
It \add is\add* a trespass offering : he hath certainly trespassed against the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
